member.name: T:VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Crypto.Cipher.Asymmetric.Encrypt.NTRU.Arithmetic.SchonhageStrassen
member.summary: An implementation of the Schnhage-Strassen algorithm for multiplying large numbers.
member.remarks:
Guiding Publications:
Arnold Schnhage und Volker Strassen: Schnelle Multiplikation groer ZahlenSchnelle Multiplikation groer Zahlen.
Eine verstandliche Beschreibung des Schonhage-Strassen-AlgorithmusEine verstandliche Beschreibung des Schonhage-Strassen-Algorithmus.
Numbers are internally represented as int arrays; the ints are interpreted as unsigned numbers.

member.name: M:VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Crypto.Cipher.Asymmetric.Encrypt.NTRU.Arithmetic.SchonhageStrassen.AddModFn(System.Int32[],System.Int32[])
member.summary:
Adds two positive numbers (meaning they are interpreted as unsigned) modulo 2^2^N+1, where N is A.Length*32/2; in other words, n is half the number of bits in A.
Both input values are given as int arrays; they must be the same length. The result is returned in the first argument.
member.param: A number in base 2^32 starting with the lowest digit; the length must be a power of 2
A number in base 2^32 starting with the lowest digit; the length must be a power of 2

member.name: M:VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Crypto.Cipher.Asymmetric.Encrypt.NTRU.Arithmetic.SchonhageStrassen.AddShifted(System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds two numbers, A and B, after shifting B by numElements elements.
member.param: A number in base 2^32 starting with the lowest digit
A number in base 2^32 starting with the lowest digit
member.remarks: Both numbers are given as int arrays and must be positive numbers (meaning they are interpreted as unsigned). The result is returned in the first argument. If any elements of B are shifted outside the valid range for A, they are dropped.

member.name: M:VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Crypto.Cipher.Asymmetric.Encrypt.NTRU.Arithmetic.SchonhageStrassen.AppendBits(System.Int32[],System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads BitLenB bits from B, starting at array index StartB, and copies them into A, starting at bit BitLenA. The result is returned in A.

member.name: M:VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Crypto.Cipher.Asymmetric.Encrypt.NTRU.Arithmetic.SchonhageStrassen.CyclicShiftRight(System.Int32[],System.Int32)
member.summary:
Cyclicly shifts a number to the right modulo 2^2^n+1 and returns the result in a new array.
"Right" means towards the lower array indices and the lower bits; this is equivalent to a multiplication by 2^(-numBits) modulo 2^2^n+1. The number n is a.Length*32/2; in other words, n is half the number of bits in A. Both input values are given as int arrays; they must be the same length.
member.param: A number in base 2^32 starting with the lowest digit; the length must be a power of 2

member.name: M:VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Crypto.Cipher.Asymmetric.Encrypt.NTRU.Arithmetic.SchonhageStrassen.CyclicShiftLeftBits(System.Int32[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Shifts a number to the left modulo 2^2^n+1 and returns the result in a new array.
member.param: A number in base 2^32 starting with the lowest digit; the length must be a power of 2

remarks.para: "Left" means towards the lower array indices and the lower bits; this is equivalent to a multiplication by 2^numBits modulo 2^2^n+1. The number n is a.Length*32/2; in other words, n is half the number of bits in A. Both input values are given as int arrays; they must be the same length. The result is returned in the first argument.

member.name: M:VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Crypto.Cipher.Asymmetric.Encrypt.NTRU.Arithmetic.SchonhageStrassen.CyclicShiftLeftElements(System.Int32[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Cyclicly shifts an array towards the higher indices by numElements elements and returns the result in a new array.

member.name: M:VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Crypto.Cipher.Asymmetric.Encrypt.NTRU.Arithmetic.SchonhageStrassen.Dft(System.Int32[][],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs a Fermat Number Transform on an array whose elements are int arrays.

remarks.para:
A is assumed to be the lower half of the full array and the upper half is assumed to be all zeros. The number of subarrays in A must be 2^n if m is even and 2^(n+1) if m is odd.
Each subarray must be ceil(2^(n-1)) bits in length.
* n must be equal to m/2-1.

member.name: M:VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Crypto.Cipher.Asymmetric.Encrypt.NTRU.Arithmetic.SchonhageStrassen.Idft(System.Int32[][],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs a modified Inverse Fermat Number Transform on an array whose elements are int arrays.
member.param: Array to process: Must be ceil(2^(n-1)) bits in length
member.remarks: The modification is that the last step (the one where the upper half is subtracted from the lower half) is omitted. A is assumed to be the upper half of the full array and the upper half is assumed to be all zeros. The number of subarrays in A must be 2^n if m is even and 2^(n+1) if m is odd.

member.summary: Multiplies two BigIntegers using the Schnhage-Strassen algorithm.

member.name: M:VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Crypto.Cipher.Asymmetric.Encrypt.NTRU.Arithmetic.SchonhageStrassen.Multiply(System.Int32[],System.Int32[])
member.summary:
Multiplies two positive numbers represented as int arrays, i.e. in base 2^32.
Positive means an int is always interpreted as an unsigned number, regardless of the sign bit.
The arrays must be ordered least significant to most significant, so the least significant digit must be at index 0. Schnhage-Strassen is used unless the numbers are in a range where Karatsuba is more efficient.

member.summary: Adds two positive numbers (meaning they are interpreted as unsigned) modulo 2^numBits. Both input values are given as int arrays. The result is returned in the first argument.

member.name: M:VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Crypto.Cipher.Asymmetric.Encrypt.NTRU.Arithmetic.SchonhageStrassen.Multiply(System.Int32[],System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Int32)
member.remarks: Schnhage-Strassen is used unless the numbers are in a range where Karatsuba is more efficient. The Schnhage-Strassen algorithm works as follows: Given numbers a and b, split both numbers into pieces of length 2^(n-1) bits. Take the low n+2 bits of each piece of a, zero-pad them to 3n+5 bits, and concatenate them to a new number u. Do the same for b to obtain v. Calculate all pieces of z' by multiplying u and v (using Schnhage-Strassen or another algorithm). The product will contain all pieces of a*b mod n+2. Pad the pieces of a and b from step 1 to 2^(n+1) bits. Perform a Discrete Fourier Transform (DFT) on the padded pieces. Calculate all pieces of z" by multiplying the i-th piece of a by the i-th piece of b. Perform an Inverse Discrete Fourier Transform (IDFT) on z". z" will contain all pieces of a*b mod Fn where Fn=2^2^n+1. Calculate all pieces of z such that each piece is congruent to z' modulo n+2 and congruent to z" modulo Fn. This is done using the Chinese remainder theorem. Calculate c by adding z_i * 2^(i*2^(n-1)) for all i, where z_i is the i-th piece of z. Return c reduced modulo 2^2^m+1.

member.remarks: Subtracts two positive numbers (meaning they are interpreted as unsigned) modulo 2^2^n+1, where n is a.Length*32/2; in other words, n is half the number of bits in A. Both input values are given as int arrays; they must be the same length. The result is returned in the first argument.

summary.h3: SPX: An extended implementation of the Serpent encryption cipher.
summary.para: SPX is an implementation of the SerpentSerpent block cipher, extended to use a 512 bit key.

revisionHistory.revision: Secondary release; updates to layout and documentation

item.description: Valid Key sizes are 128, 192, 256 and 512 bits (16, 24, 32 and 64 bytes).
Block size is 16 bytes wide.
Valid Rounds assignments are 32, 40, 48, 56, and 64, default is 32.

remarks.para: The Key Schedule has been written so that it can both accept a larger key size of 512 bits, and produce the required number of working keys with a variable number of diffusion rounds.

The diffusion rounds, (the portion of the cipher that does the actual mixing of plaintext into ciphertext), is exactly the same with every key length, only it can now process an increased number of rounds, from 32; the standard, up to 64 rounds. This increase in the ciphers diffusion cycles makes linear and differential analysis more difficult, and the larger key size ensures that it can not be brute forced.

item.description: Serpent: Specification.
Inspired in part by the Bouncy Castle Java Release 1.51.

summary.h3: An implementation of the Modular Exponentiation Generator random number generator: MODEXPG
summary.para: Implements MODEXPG as defined in the NIST document: SP800-22 1aSP800-22A, Section D.6

item.description: NIST SP800-22 1a, Section D.3: A Statistical Test Suite for Random and Pseudorandom Number Generators for Cryptographic Applications.
NIST SP800-90B: SP800-90BRecommendation for the Entropy Sources Used for Random Bit Generation.
NIST Fips 140-2: Fips 140-2Security Requirments For Cryptographic Modules.
RFC 4086: RFC 4086Randomness Requirements for Security.
This code based on the excellent Java version by Zur Aougav: ModulusExponentPrng class.

summary.h3: HKDF: An implementation of an Hash based Key Derivation Function.
summary.para: HKDF as outlined in RFC 5869RFC 5869

item.description: Can be initialized with a Digest or a Mac.
The Constructors DisposeEngine parameter determines if Digest engine is destroyed when is called on this class; default is true.
Salt size should be multiple of Digest block size.
Ikm size should be Digest hash return size.
Nonce and Ikm are optional, (but recommended).
RFC 5869: Specification.
HKDF Scheme: Whitepaper.
Based on the Bouncy Castle Java Release 1.51 version.

member.summary: Creates the initial state by chaining the previous state value with the config block, then initializes the hash. This starts a new UBI block type with the standard Payload type.

summary.h3: Skein256: An implementation of the Skein digest with a 256 bit digest return size.
summary.para: SHA-3 finalistNIST IR7896: The SkeinSkein digest

item.description: Block size is 32 bytes, (256 bits).
Digest size is 32 bytes, (256 bits).

list.item: The method wraps the and DoFinal methods, and resets the internal state./>

item.description: The method does NOT reset the internal state; call to reinitialize.
The Skein Hash Function Family: Skein V1.1.
Skein Provable Security Support for the Skein Hash Family.
SHA3: Third-Round Report of the SHA-3 Cryptographic Hash Algorithm Competition.
Adapted from the excellent project by Alberto Fajardo: Skeinfish Release 0.50.

summary.h3: Implements a Cipher Block Chaining Mode: CBC.
summary.para: CBC as outlined in the NIST document: SP800-38ASP800-38A

item.description: Parallel processing is enabled on decryption by passing a block size of to the transform.
must be divisible by .
Parallel block calculation ex. int blocklen = (data.Length / cipher.ParallelMinimumSize) * 10
Cipher Engine is automatically disposed of unless DisposeEngine is set to false in the class constructor
NIST: SP800-38A.

member.name: T:VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Numeric.BitLevel
member.summary:
Static library that provides all the bit level operations for BigInteger.
The operations are:
Left Shifting
Right Shifting
Bit Clearing
Bit Setting
Bit Counting
Bit Testing
Getting of the lowest bit set
All operations are provided in immutable way, and some in both mutable and immutable.

member.name: M:VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Numeric.BitLevel.BitCount(VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Numeric.BigInteger)
member.summary:
Returns the number of bits in the binary representation of this which differ from the sign bit.
Use BitLength(0) if you want to know the length of the binary value in bits. If this is positive the result is equivalent to the number of bits set in the binary representation of this. If this is negative the result is equivalent to the number of bits set in the binary representation of -this - 1.

member.name: M:VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Numeric.BitLevel.BitLength(VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Numeric.BigInteger)
member.summary:
Returns the length of the value's two's complement representation without leading zeros for positive numbers / without leading ones for negative values.
The two's complement representation of this will be at least BitLength() + 1 bits long. The value will fit into an int if bitLength() < 32 or into a long if bitLength() < 64.

member.name: M:VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Numeric.BitLevel.FlipBit(VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Numeric.BigInteger,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns a new BigInteger which has the same binary representation as this but with the bit at position N flipped.
The result is equivalent to this ^ 2^N.
member.param: Position where the bit in this has to be flipped
member.exception: Thrown if a negative bit address is used

member.name: M:VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Numeric.BitLevel.InplaceShiftLeft(VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Numeric.BigInteger,System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs val <= count, val should have enough place (and one digit more)

member.name: M:VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Numeric.BitLevel.InplaceShiftRight(VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Numeric.BigInteger,System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs Value >>= count where Value is a positive number.

member.name: M:VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Numeric.BitLevel.NonZeroDroppedBits(System.Int32,System.Int32[])
member.summary: Check if there are 1s in the lowest bits of this BigInteger

member.name: M:VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Numeric.BitLevel.ShiftLeft(VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Numeric.BigInteger,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns a new BigInteger whose value is this << N.
The result is equivalent to this * 2^n if n >= 0. The shift distance may be negative which means that this is shifted right. The result then corresponds to Floor(this / 2^(-n)).
member.returns: Returns this << N if n >= 0, this >> (-N) otherwise

member.name: M:VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Numeric.BitLevel.ShiftLeft(System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Abstractly shifts left an array of integers in little endian (i.e. shift it right). Total shift distance in bits is intCount * 32 + count
member.param: The number of bits to shift

member.name: M:VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Numeric.BitLevel.ShiftLeftOneBit(VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Numeric.BigInteger)
member.summary: Shifts the source digits left one bit, creating a value whose magnitude is doubled.

member.name: M:VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Numeric.BitLevel.ShiftLeftOneBit(System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Shifts the source digits left one bit, creating a value whose magnitude is doubled.

member.name: M:VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Numeric.BitLevel.ShiftRight(VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Numeric.BigInteger,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns a new BigInteger whose value is this >> N
For negative arguments, the result is also negative. The shift distance may be negative which means that this is shifted left.
member.returns: this >> N, if N >= 0; this << (-n) otherwise

member.name: M:VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Numeric.BitLevel.ShiftRight(System.Int32[],System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns a new BigInteger whose value is this >> N
For negative arguments, the result is also negative. The shift distance may be negative which means that this is shifted left.
member.returns: this >> N, if N >= 0; this << (-n) otherwise

member.name: M:VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Numeric.BitLevel.TestBit(VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Numeric.BigInteger,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Tests whether the bit at position N in this is set.
The result is equivalent to this & (2^n) != 0.
member.param: Position where the bit in this has to be inspected.

member.name: T:VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Crypto.Seed.XSPRsg
member.summary:
Generates seed material for a CSPrng using various processed system counters passed through an XorShift+ generator.
An original construct (experimental) meant to provide an alternative to the RNGCryptoServiceProvider as a source of pseudo random seeding material. This class is suitable for generating seeds for a Prng or Drbg implementation.

example.description: Example of getting a seed value:

remarks.para: The seed generator uses system counters and state information, that are pre-processed via modular arithmetic, converted to a byte array, and then processed with an XorShift+ random generator. The maximum allocation size is 1024 bytes.
remarks.description: XSPGenerator uses the following state values as initial entropy sources:

item.description: Network: Combined interface values for the BytesSent, UnicastPacketsSent, NonUnicastPacketsSent, BytesReceived, UnicastPacketsReceived and NonUnicastPacketsReceived values.
Current Process: Handle, StartTime ticks, PeakWorkingSet64, NonpagedSystemMemorySize64, PagedSystemMemorySize64, HandleCount, and Id.
Combined running processes and threads: WorkingSet64, VirtualMemorySize64, StartAddress, Id, and CurrentPriority.
Environment: Ticks since startup, the Time in Ticks.

member.summary: Initialize this class

member.summary: Re-initializes the generator with new state

member.summary: Get a pseudo random seed byte array
member.param: The size of the seed returned; up to a maximum of 1024 bytes
member.exception: Thrown if the requested size exceeds maximum allowable allocation (1024 bytes)

member.summary: Dispose of this class

member.summary: Algorithm name

summary.h3: An implementation of a passphrase based PKCS#5 random number generator.
summary.para: Implements PKCS#5 as defined in RFC 2898

item.description: RFC 2898: Specification.

member.name: T:VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Crypto.Cipher.Asymmetric.Encrypt.NTRU.NTRUParameters
member.summary:
Creates, reads and writes parameter settings for NtruEncrypt.
Predefined parameter sets are available and new ones can be created as well. These predefined settings are accessable through the class

example.description: Create a parameter set and write to stream:

item.description: OId - Unique identifier; Family, Set, SubSet, and Designator. The NTRU family must be 2 corresponding with the enumeration.
N - Degree Parameter. A positive integer. The associated NTRU lattice has dimension 2N.
q - Large Modulus. A positive integer. The associated NTRU lattice is a convolution modular lattice of modulus q.
p - Small Modulus. An integer or a polynomial.
Df, Dg - Private Key Spaces. Sets of small polynomials from which the private keys are selected.
Dm - Plaintext Space. Set of polynomials that represent encryptable messages.
Dr - Blinding Value Space. Set of polynomials from which the temporary blinding value used during encryption is selected.
Center - Centering Method. A means of performing mod q reduction on decryption.
NTRU: A Ring Based Public Key Crypto SystemNTRU Crypto.
Optimizations for NTRUNTRU Optimizations.
Adaptive Key Recovery Attacks on NTRU-based Somewhat Homomorphic Encryption SchemesNTRU Adaptive.
Efficient Embedded Security Standards (EESS)NTRU EESS.
Practical lattice-based cryptography: NTRUEncrypt and NTRUSignNTRU Practical.
NTRU Cryptosystems Technical ReportNTRU Technical.
Inspired by the excellent java project NTRU Encrypt by Tim Buktu: Release 1.2, and the NTRUOpenSourceProject/ntru-crypto project provided by Security Innovation, Inc NTRU Encrypt.

member.summary: Constructs a parameter set that uses ternary private keys (i.e. PolyType=SIMPLE)
member.param: OId - Unique identifier; Family, Set, SubSet, and Designator. The NTRU family must be 2 corresponding with the enumeration.
The ring dimension; the number of polynomial coefficients
Number of ones in the private polynomial f
Minimum acceptable number of -1's, 0's, and 1's in the polynomial m in the last encryption step

Whether f=1+p*F for a ternary F (true) or f is ternary (false)
The Message Digest engine to use; default is SHA512
The pseudo random generator engine to use; default is CTRPrng

member.name: T:VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Crypto.Cipher.Asymmetric.Encrypt.NTRU.Curve.Curve25519
member.summary:
Generic 64-bit integer implementation of Curve25519 ECDH.
Written by Matthijs van Duin, 200608242056 Based on work by Daniel J Bernstein; A state of the art Diffie-Hellman functionA state-of-the-art Diffie-Hellman function Ported from C to Java by Dmitry Skiba [sahn0], 23/02/08. Ported to C# by John Underhill, 14/03/15. Original:

example.code: s is the private key for signing P is the corresponding internal key Z is the context data (signer internal key or certificate, etc)

m = hash(Z, message); h = m XOR r verify25519(Y, v, h, P)
confirm r == hash(Y)

remarks.para: It would seem to me that it would be simpler to have the signer directly do h = hash(m, Y) and send that to the recipient instead of r, who can verify the signature by checking h == hash(m, Y). If there are any problems with such a scheme, please let me know.
Also, EC-KCDSA (like most DS algorithms) picks x random, which is a waste of perfectly good entropy, but does allow Y to be calculated in advance of (or parallel to) hashing the message.

member.name: M:VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Crypto.Cipher.Asymmetric.Encrypt.NTRU.Curve.Curve25519.MulaSmall(System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.remarks: p[m..n+m-1] = q[m..n+m-1] + z * x, n is the size of x n+m is the size of p and q

member.name: M:VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Crypto.Cipher.Asymmetric.Encrypt.NTRU.Curve.Curve25519.Mula32(System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.remarks: p += x * y * z where z is a small integer. x is size 32, y is size t, p is size 32+t y is allowed to overlap with p+32 if you don't care about the upper half

member.name: M:VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Crypto.Cipher.Asymmetric.Encrypt.NTRU.Curve.Curve25519.DivMod(System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.remarks: divide r (size n) by d (size t), returning quotient q and remainder r quotient is size n-t+1, remainder is size t requires t > 0 & d[t-1] != 0 requires that r[-1] and d[-1] are valid memory locations q may overlap with r+t

member.name: M:VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Crypto.Cipher.Asymmetric.Encrypt.NTRU.Curve.Curve25519.Egcd32(System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.remarks: Returns x if a contains the gcd, y if b. Also, the returned buffer contains the inverse of a mod b, as 32-byte signed. x and y must have 64 bytes space for temporary use. requires that a[-1] and b[-1] are valid memory locations

member.remarks: Check if reduced-form input >= 2^255-19

member.name: M:VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Crypto.Cipher.Asymmetric.Encrypt.NTRU.Curve.Curve25519.Pack(VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Crypto.Cipher.Asymmetric.Encrypt.NTRU.Curve.Curve25519.Long10,System.Byte[])
member.remarks: Convert from internal format to little-endian byte format. The number must be in a reduced form which is output by the following ops: unpack, mul, sqr set -- if input in range 0 .. P25 If you're unsure if the number is reduced, first multiply it by 1.

member.remarks: Set a number to value, which must be in range -185861411 .. 185861411
Add/subtract two numbers. The inputs must be in reduced form, and the output isn't, so to do another addition or subtraction on the output, first multiply it by one to reduce it.

Multiply two numbers. The output is in reduced form, the inputs need not be.

member.name: M:VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Crypto.Cipher.Asymmetric.Encrypt.NTRU.Curve.Curve25519.Sqr(VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Crypto.Cipher.Asymmetric.Encrypt.NTRU.Curve.Curve25519.Long10,VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Crypto.Cipher.Asymmetric.Encrypt.NTRU.Curve.Curve25519.Long10)
member.remarks: Square a number. Optimization of mul25519(x2, x, x)

member.name: M:VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Crypto.Cipher.Asymmetric.Encrypt.NTRU.Curve.Curve25519.Recip(VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Crypto.Cipher.Asymmetric.Encrypt.NTRU.Curve.Curve25519.Long10,VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Crypto.Cipher.Asymmetric.Encrypt.NTRU.Curve.Curve25519.Long10,System.Int32)
member.remarks: Calculates a reciprocal. The output is in reduced form, the inputs need not be. Simply calculates y = x^(p-2) so it's not too fast. When sqrtassist is true, it instead calculates y = x^((p-5)/8)

member.name: M:VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Crypto.Cipher.Asymmetric.Encrypt.NTRU.Curve.Curve25519.IsNegative(VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Crypto.Cipher.Asymmetric.Encrypt.NTRU.Curve.Curve25519.Long10)
member.remarks: Checks if x is "negative", requires reduced input

member.name: M:VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Crypto.Cipher.Asymmetric.Encrypt.NTRU.Curve.Curve25519.Sqrt(VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Crypto.Cipher.Asymmetric.Encrypt.NTRU.Curve.Curve25519.Long10,VTDev.Libraries.CEXEngine.Crypto.Cipher.Asymmetric.Encrypt.NTRU.Curve.Curve25519.Long10)
member.remarks: A square root
t1 = ax + az t2 = ax - az
A = P + Q where: X(A) = ax/az X(P) = (t1+t2)/(t1-t2) X(Q) = (t3+t4)/(t3-t4) X(P-Q) = dx clobbers t1 and t2, preserves t3 and t4
B = 2 * Q where: X(B) = bx/bz X(Q) = (t3+t4)/(t3-t4) clobbers t1 and t2, preserves t3 and t4
Y^2 = X^3 + 486662 X^2 + X t is a temporary

member.remarks: P = kG and s = sign(P)/k

summary.h3: Implements a Parallel Segmented Counter Mode: CTR.
summary.para: CTR as outlined in the NIST document: SP800-38ASP800-38A

item.description: Parallel processing is enabled by passing a block size of to the transform.
must be divisible by .
Parallel block calculation ex. int blocklen = (data.Length / cipher.ParallelMinimumSize) * 10
Cipher Engine is automatically disposed of unless DisposeEngine is set to false in the class constructor
NIST: SP800-38A.
